meanings.definition: Take and use (something belonging to someone else) with the intention of returning it.
meanings.sent1: She borrows a book from the library every week.
meanings.sent2: He borrows his friend's bicycle for a quick ride.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel borrows nuts from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Time borrows moments from our lives, never to return them.
meanings.sent5: The wind borrows the fragrance of flowers as it dances through the garden.

meanings.definition: Obtain or receive (money) on loan with the promise or understanding that it will be repaid.
meanings.sent1: She borrows some money from her sister to buy a new dress.
meanings.sent2: He borrows a loan from the bank to start his business.
meanings.sent3: The ant borrows sugar from the neighboring ant hill.
meanings.sent4: Hope borrows from the future to pay for our dreams.
meanings.sent5: The river borrows strength from the mountains as it flows towards the sea.
